title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 February 2015 - XWiki

03:10 <kyndel\_\_> Hi there. I want the main page of my wiki to be a regular page, not a reference to the dashboard. how can i do that?

14:04 <Slashman> has quit  
14:06 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <fmancinelli> Hi guys, I would like to do the following: I have a page X.Y in a XAR Maven Build. I would like to take an artifact and attach it to X.Y so that the resulting XAR will have X.Y with the artifact as an attachment. Is there an easy way to do this?  
14:34 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: there is a maven plugin for this and you can find example in old XEM build  
14:34 <tmortagne> (it used to attache XE XAR to create a wiki template from it)  
14:35 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: see https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-manager/blob/xwiki-manager-4.5/xwiki-manager-ui/pom.xml  
14:35 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:35 <tmortagne> it get xwiki-enterprise-ui-all artifact and then attach it  
14:37 <fmancinelli> tmortagne: thanks! I knew something like that existed but couldn't remember exactly what was it :)  
14:37 <tmortagne> but be carefull with this plugin  
14:37 <tmortagne> I think you loose xobject or something like this  
14:38 <fmancinelli> tmortagne: ok. Anyway for what I have to do it's fine  
14:38 <tmortagne> ok

16:42 <evalica> has quit  
16:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: don't know if you've seen http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-commons%20Quality%20Checks/org.xwiki.commons$xwiki-commons-extension-handler-jar/165/testReport/org.xwiki.extension.jar/JarExtensionHandlerTest/org\_xwiki\_extension\_jar\_JarExtensionHandlerTest/  
16:45 <vmassol> apparently this message is not output all the time  
16:45 <tmortagne> yes it seems to be a flickering  
16:45 <tmortagne> I saw it but did not had time to debug yet  
16:46 <vmassol> ok I'll leave it to you to check when you have some time. If you prefer you can put some "exclude" FTM although we should fix the test  
16:46 <polx> has quit  
16:48 <RamonaConoro> has quit  
16:48 <tmortagne> the test itself does not really care about saved status which is done asynchronously, I guess sometimes the actual save is done too late and something has already been deleted, best is probably to disable the status save some way  
16:51 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <momomomomo> has quit  
16:59 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki

17:18 <lucaa> has quit  
17:21 <vmassol> seems thomas has introduced some bug in the recent commits related to RenderingContext  
17:21 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/bf06548d6e19754ef333/raw/gistfile1.txt  
17:33 <lucaa1> has quit  
17:38 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:43 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: any particular reason we are asking for programming rights in the wiki user script service? It is currently causing XWIKI-11735 since the wiki is created by a user without PR, so the scripts that use the script service do not have PR.  
17:43 <Enygma`> the entire wiki user script service API is full of PR checks  
17:43 <gdelhumeau> yes, if not any user could create a script that accept an invitation  and say to the user "go to that page"  
17:44 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
17:44 <Enygma`> but then we end up doing this to all our script services and that is bad IMO  
17:44 <Enygma`> "just to be safe"  
17:44 <gdelhumeau> that is why I don't do it anymore actually  
17:45 <Enygma`> so would you agree that it would be a good idea to remove it from that API and only ask for edit/admin rights on the affected resources?  
17:48 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:53 <msmeria> has quit  
17:53 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
17:53 <momomomomo> has quit  
18:03 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`: actually I think the clean fix is the Signed Script  
18:03 <gdelhumeau> or to run DW with superadmin  
18:04 <gdelhumeau> that's what http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Wiki+Flavor+Application do BTW  
18:04 <gdelhumeau> to avoid this PR problems  
18:04 <gdelhumeau> I have to go sorry  
18:04 <Enygma`> k
